intro: Mascarenhasia boivinii, commonly known as the Mascarene starwood, is a flowering plant native to the Mascarene Islands in the Indian Ocean. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in coastal or limestone areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
